issues.description: The problem statement's class diagram and descriptions indicate that acceptSupplyDelivery should be a public ("+") static method on SealSaloon (see UML: +acceptSupplyDelivery(String, int, int): void). In the solution, acceptSupplyDelivery is implemented as a package-private static method (no access modifier). This is a visibility mismatch: students reading the UML/description will expect a public API method (and the instructions also emphasize adding getters for private fields and following the diagram), while the solution uses a narrower visibility. This discrepancy may confuse students about the intended visibility and access level of the method and about whether it should be callable from other classes or tests.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the method's visibility match the diagram/specification. Declare the method as public static void acceptSupplyDelivery(String name, int price, int quantity) in SealSaloon (i.e., add the public modifier). Alternatively, if package-private visibility is intentional, update the problem statement/UML to show a non-public method to avoid confusion.
